message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms indicate obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD), which is most effectively treated with cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) and fluoxetine, an SSRI antidepressant. Clonazepam is used for generalized anxiety disorder and panic disorder. Psychodynamic psychotherapy may not be as effective in treating OCD, and aripiprazole is mainly used for schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms described suggest obsessive-compulsive disorder, which can be treated with cognitive behavioral therapy and fluoxetine, an SSRI commonly used for OCD. Clonazepam is used for anxiety disorders, but it's not the first-line treatment for OCD. Psychodynamic psychotherapy and citalopram or aripiprazole are not recommended for OCD.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has symptoms of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD). Among the options, cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) is considered the gold standard treatment for OCD. Fluoxetine, a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI), is also effective in treating OCD. Clonazepam is a benzodiazepine, which may provide temporary relief of symptoms but does not address the underlying anxiety disorder. Psychodynamic psychotherapy and citalopram or aripiprazole are not first-line treatments for OCD.

Clonazepam is a benzodiazepine that may provide some relief but is not as effective as SSRIs. Psychodynamic psychotherapy and aripiprazole are not recommended for treating OCD.
